result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant

defendant.name: Ackley Dechant, Gage Ryon
defendant.address: PO Box 12 52605 Oak Street, Drummond, WI 54832

records.addlTxt: 9:02 AM Defendant Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant in court.  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. appeared by video for Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty - during prelim hearing, Judge McKnight stated that he needed to recuse himself.  Still need to complete prelim examination.  State agrees.  Atty - asking for a continuation of prelim there was testimony, asking for review of transcript.  State- no position.  Court asking State to contact court reporter for transcript and than set matter for prelim.  Court ordered that the transcript to be produced.  Parties to coordinate with JA to schedule Prelim.  There is a waiver of time limits.  Def to appear in person for prelim.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 9:17 AM Defendant Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant in court.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. appeared by video for Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant.  Attorney having prelim hearing.  State calls witness Jonathan Kroll, sworn in.  Witness identifies def in court room.  Attorney questions witness.  Judge states a new judge will be assigned to case, stay in contact with attorney for a new date.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant not in court.  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. appeared by video for Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant. Witness is present Atty advise Court Def is running late. Atty had staff call Def -- 3 mins prior was on Main Street driving towards Atty's office -- nobody is arriving. 8 mins past scheduled hearing. State commenting -- warrant and no BBF request. Court orders: nationwide warrant. 9:53 AM -- Def arrived in @ Atty's office. Warrant is cancelled but Def lost privileges to appear in-person moving forward. Reschedule PH. Atty, State and Witness can appear remote. PH scheduled for 7/28 @ 9:00 AM -- Def MUST appear in-person.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:05 AM Defendant Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. need to Schd a prelim in the case. 
The def can appear by ZOOM if he apprs by video or by stipulation of identification  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Scheduling conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Talked about his right to an atty at last hearing. Def comments- thinks he found an atty and waiting for a phone call.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:31 AM Defendant Gage Ryon Ackley Dechant in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Def has rec copy of criminal complaint -- Def understands max pen and range. Def is currently working on getting an Atty on own, if not, go through Pub Def office. Def requesting a week or two adjournment. Def can appear via Zoom for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Def may appr by Zoom at next hearing on 3/21/2022.
